H0.text: Which artery is the main source of blood for the leg. Popliteal artery

H1.text: Which artery is the main source of blood for the leg. Tibial artery

H2.text: Which artery is the main source of blood for the leg. Peroneal artery

H3.text: Which artery is the main source of blood for the leg. Femoral pulse

A4.text: The femoral artery is a large artery in the thigh and the main arterial supply to the thigh and leg.

A5.text: The femoral artery becomes the popliteal artery as it passes through the adductor hiatus in the adductor magnus near the junction of the middle and distal thirds of the thigh.

A6.text: The popliteal artery is the continuation of the femoral artery.

A7.text: The popliteal artery is shown in association with major landmarks in the lower extremity.

A8.text: The image is labeled 'pulse', indicating the presence of a pulse in the lower extremity.
